Solid game, can't wait for the sequel.

Half Life is the basis for every modern first person shooter. Blindly ignoring its lack of levels or removal from the main character's perspective, both of which are now par for the course, it is best known for revolutionizing the scripted event, non-playable characters and enemy tactics. Every game we play today is either a shoot-fest, descended from Doom, or a thinking man's shooter that traces its lineage to Half Life. Its multiplayer and mod scene also gave birth to the class shooter, due to the proliferation of Team Fortress via the updated "Classic" version as well as the realistic shooter and multiplayer-only shooter, courtesy Counterstrike. 

Half Life 2 offered physics as a gameplay mechanic, which is why we have Portal and any other FPS title that has weaponry suited to interact rather than merely destroy. It doesn't get enough credit for its structure, however, though I suspect many developers know what I am talking about. From hopping into a car for a long drive, hitting the waves for a chase or setting up turrets for the oncoming storm, the reason games now have segments that break from the monotony of their formal genre is because HL2 proved how perfectly you can blend them. 

The worst game in the series, HL2 Episode 1, is merely one of the best titles in the genre. It is also one of the most groundbreaking, forcing the player to rely on an A.I. controlled partner for the firepower on enemies lit up with a flashlight OR to invent a weapon for every encounter with the gravity gun. These mechanics still have yet to be equaled by any other title featuring computer-controlled allies. 

Do you want some more action? HL Ep. 2 has your action. Jump in your car and ram those fucking Hunters while you race to get a magnusson device onto the Strider's back in time to save White Forest. Simply the most intense action sequences in the history of the FPS medium, no matter how many times we revisit Normandy in the next Call of Battlefield. All done without sacrificing a hint of nuance or story for which the series is so well remembered.

So yes--yes I nominate to award this, the last entry in the series, as the GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL. Rise and shine, Mister Freeman. Rise and... shine. Not that I... wish to imply you have been sleeping on the job. No one is more deserving of a rest, and all the effort in the world would have gone to waste until... well, let's just say your hour has... come again.

Half-Life 2: Episodio 2 es una buena continuación de la historia vista anteriormente en Half-Life 2. Aunque usa unas mecánicas parecidas a las ya vistas, hace un bueno número de avances y mejoras respecto a sus predecesores. 

En primer lugar es destacable la caracterización de cada uno de los personajes que nos habíamos encontrado con anterioridad. La naturalidad de las expresiones y de las animaciones consigue que parezcan muchísimo más humanos.

Otro aspecto destacable son los escenarios (los más vastos y realistas que encontrarás en un Half-Life).

Por supuesto, aunque esto ya ha sido un hándicap de la serie, la atmósfera es sublime y los tiroteos en sí son endiabladamente divertidos y satisfactorios (ya sea con cada una de las armas que se nos proporciona o con la genial pistola antigravedad).

Conclusión: Merece la pena siempre y cuando se haya jugado a las anteriores entregas (por lo menos de Half-Life 2 en adelante), y si todavía no habéis disfrutado de esta saga, haceros un favor y compradla. Merece cada céntimo que vale.

It may not be the perfect sequel for the award-winning Half-Life 2, but it's certainly worth your time and money.
The formula is the same used for Half-Life 2, a first person shooter with puzzle elements scattered around the game that temporarily make you stop shooting to start and think how to progress, with improved graphics and destruction, new enemies and larger maps that give the impression of freedom.

Not only I recommend this game, but I suggest you to play the entire series wholeheartedly.

P.S. After recent developments, with Valve focusing increasingly on the Steam store, VR hardware and "games-as-a-service", and former Valve lead writer Marc Laidlaw leaking the supposed plot for "Episode 3", the chances of a sequel of this game actually seeing the light of the day are pretty slim, if not none at all.
So "Abandon all hope, ye who enter here".
A great expansion to a terrific franchise ...that desperately needs to be resurrected.

Lembro-me de quando finalizei séries como The Sopranos e, principalmente, Breaking Bad; você sente um vazio na alma, sensação de que nada mais faz sentido, e é exatamente esse sentimento que você terá ao finalizar este game, só que muito pior, porque você quer que venha uma sequência, mas no fundo, lá no fundo, você sente que "Foi bom enquanto durou" (Citação de imbecil, desculpe-me). Talvez, seja o maior game já feito ao lado de Portal e Rambo, mas isso o tempo dirá.

[h1]하프라이프 2의 대미를 장식할 마지막 에피소드[/h1]

평점은 7/10
플레이타임 : 4~5h

장점
+하프라이프 2에 썼던 내용들.(타격감, 혼자하지 않는 것 같은 동료, 다양한 무기, 효율적으로 사용한 사운드 등등...)
단점
- 3D멀미.

에피소드 원에 비해 개선된 점이 많이 돋보이는 에피소드 투입니다.
다행히 전작에 비해 돋보이는 새로운 요소들이 많아서  재미있게 플레이할 수 있엇습니다;.
그냥 탈출하는 이야기던 에피소드 원에 비해 많은 내용이 담겨져 있어서 지루하지 않았습니다.
뭣보다 난해한 길찾기가 전편에 비해 심하지 않습니다!

다만 하프라이프 시리즈(하프라이프1~하프라이프 에피소드2)중에서 가장 난이도가 어렵습니다. 몸도 튼튼하고 공격력도 강한 콤바인 헌터의 등장때문인지 정말 수없이 많이 죽었습니다.

If you haven't played Half-Life 2 at all, you're missing out on (imo) one of the best games every made.  Gameplay is great, characters are excellent, and the story, OH BABY THE STORY.  Anyway, they moved from big releases to episodic releases as a strategy for bringing content out more frequently.  

They then released episodes 1 & 2 within a year of each other.  Episode 2 ended on a huge cliffhanger that left people salivating for more.  They then proceeded to do absolutely nothing for over 9 years (at the time of writing this), and at this point will probably never finish Half-Life 2's story.

I still hold hope to this day that they will release something, but the longer they take, the less likely it will ever happen, and consider it has been 9 years, there is almost no chance they will ever release something.  We can take solace, however, in the fact they didn't release something that fell short.  I think I'd rather they release nothing than something that blows goats.
